1.text: In the beginning, God created the heavens and the earth.

5.text: Your hands fashioned and made me, and now you have destroyed me altogether. Remember that you have made me like clay.

13.text: Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, he is a new creation. The old has passed away; behold, the new has come.

20.text: A voice was heard in Ramah, weeping and loud lamentation, Rachel weeping for her children; she refused to be comforted, because they are no more.

24.text: The Lord gave, and the Lord has taken away; blessed be the name of the Lord.

27.text: For everything there is a season, and a time for every matter under heaven: a time to be born, and a time to die.

37.text: When a woman is giving birth, she has sorrow because her hour has come, but when she has delivered the baby, she no longer remembers the anguish, for joy that a human being has been born into the world.

40.text: Behold, children are a heritage from the Lord, the fruit of the womb a reward.
